taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek rhexis, breaking, and phyllon, leaf, alluding to fissile distal leaf margins]

bio:treatment.discussion: The significant character separating Rhexophyllum from the similar genus Leptodontium is the presence of a stem central strand. There are apparently no close relatives although R. H. Zander’s (1993) phylogenetic study indicates that the genus shares an ancestor with Mironia, a similar Latin-American genus with species whose leaves are 2-stratose only along the margins of the distal lamina, and whose capsule is peristomate.

references.reference: Zander, R. H. 1994o. Rhexophyllum. In: A. J. Sharp et al., eds. The moss flora of Mexico. Mem. New York Bot. Gard. 69: 260.
